question: What is the purpose of the super keyword in inheritance?
variation: What does the super keyword do in inheritance?
chatGPTAns: The super keyword is used to access and call functions on an object's parent. It is used to access methods of the parent class from within a child class. It can also be used to access variables from the parent class, and to pass arguments to the parent's constructor when creating a new instance of the child class.
